column5: The ranger will do the job, no problems.  Sweet ride Paul...she's gorgious
WHAT! no water pressure gauge!?????
Have you not get that thing wet yet??? WTH ?
Nice ride Paul love the colour, my first boat was a princecraft and it was a pretty good boat!!!  Enjoy!!!

HTHM, no not yet. I will have it installed properly when i take it in for 1st service. it IS going in the boat for sure.Thanks BTW. Wayne. I havent even put gas in it yet Took me all day to do the installations.I wanted to do it right the first time. I will take her out after work this week.
Get it wet! Get it wet! Get it wet! And then show us more pictures.
Now the questions begin. Is a breaking in period really necessary?
Ah.. YES.. read the manual and follow the rpm suggestions as close as you can.
Perfect.The salesman spent some time explaining the break in period so i just wanted to make sure it was a necessary step to follow.
nice ride.

Should have got a 2-stroke Paul no break in really gotta take it easy on the first tank of gas which needs to be mixed 50 to 1 then your all good and I'm on my third tank now ,ready for my first tourney this weekend still haven't got it slimed yet though  had this little guy land in the boat and hang out for a bit and then head back to were he was coming from we were right in the middle of Long Point Bay.

I have the Holdiday DLX with a 60hp on the back.  Great boats!  Just like you, I went from the Fisherman to the Holiday DLX.  I am now looking at upgrading again to something with a full windsheild, bigger motor and all the tops and bling that go with it.  Guess what boat manufacturer I will be buying from?  You guessed it!  Princecraft makes one of the best boats hands down!  I will be a Princecraft owner for life.  Ab
nice looking ride congrats

Way to go Paul!!!!! I love the color of the boat. Your going to love that 4 stroke. Only problem with the 4 stroke is that when it is running you cant hear it,so before you turn the key to start it look first to make sure it's not already running and you forgot. Second problem is that they are so quite that all you hear is the water running out of the tell tail and that will make you pee every 10 minutes. I know this all to well....
Roy said the same thing on Saturday.I better keep the bailing bucket under the console just for that reason
Ya, but he has a tiller on the front..... Very nice ride Paul! I see why you were so excited.

Very nice Paul! You can't go wrong with a Princecraft either! I really like the idea of the hand controlled (hand steered) bow mount trolling motor too. You should be able to just nudge it with your knee to keep things on course.  Enjoy your new baby and have some fun!
Nice ride Paul...im miss the new boat feeling ...hope she serves you well for many years...what are ya going to name her?

Very nice Ride Paul I really like the colour.You can't go wrong with buying from Thomas Marine.Good Service and Good people. I buy alot of things there for my boat.There service dept has an amazing selection of gadgets lol.
What`s a pickerel? Nice ride.
very nice
Oh by the way, good call on the galvanized trailer.   You won't regret it.
Nice ride for sure Paul here to hoping that you get her slimmed right away.  Cheers Mike

That's a REAL PURDY Boat you have there.....you sure you want to put it in that dirty dirty water just to fish...  Now you need a nice new Red Tundra to pull that Purdy Boat.  Now go catch a fish, Bob
Nice Boat
Looks Great!

It's gonna be the D.R.White, in memory of my father. Douglas Robert White.He would have been very happy for me. I had them make matching gold letters and i will put them on later today if i finish all the other stuff i have to put on.GPS/Sonar on the console, and sonar on the bow.
Congrats Paul on the new ride She looks real nice Now you'll be fishing in style
boat porn is right!  I'm spent now and going for a smoke...
Is there any place to buy that locally?  Looks nice on the bottom of his boat,
Very nice Paul , I bet you can't wait to take her out and get fishin !
Console!!  with a tiller option on the front to keep everyone here happy.  Congrats on the new ride Paul!! Now get out there and give us a fishing report.
I love Boat PORN!!. Congrats!
WOW  I like that roof on your boat. I would like to get that for my LUND.  THE hunt begins    Very nice looking  boat  congrats !!
Very nice, Paul!!  Congrats, and, enjoy the open water season!
A nice new red Ford F150 would look better.
And it would save LOTS of gas when it's in the shop all the time...   But Paul wants to go fishing.....so TUNDRA...
Sorry Bob.... Tundra is pass√©.... Paul needs one of them beauties now

Thanks everyone Bob and Jacques, i think i'll keep my little Ranger.Dont even feeel the boat behind it. I installed the electronics today.I put my Lowrance X135 on the bow, with the transducer on the trollling motor, and i installed the HB 587 Ci sonar/GPS on the console. Now come on open season I chose tiller so i wouldnt clutter up the casting deck.Plus i can be a bit of a clutz, and wouldnt want to end up in the drink
schweet

Well as probably all of you know, i have been waiting patiently(NOT) since January of this year, to get my new ride.The 14' fisherman and 8hp was great as a reintroduction to fishing, but i knew last summer, that i would need something a bit bigger and alot faster if i was gonna fish some of the places i wanted to try. I saw this little gem in the showroom last summer, but decided to wait untill off season, and try tp save a bit.January 10 seemed like a good date.Walked in, told the salesman what i wanted and what i wanted to pay, and what i wanted for free. Told him when i would have the cash, and that was it Saved over 5K by buying off season. Here it is....finally.       Thanks to the Experts of Thomas Marine.They know how to make thier customers feels special
sweet ride! Get out there and slime her bud!
Nice Boat. That will sure get you across the water a bit quicker. Enjoy it.
Wow Paul. That's awesome. I had that same feeling a decade ago. Sweet ride. Enjoy it.
Shouldn't have any issue with anyone running into you on a misty morning Paul !  She's bright enough that you should be able to get an extra hour of fishing in after sunset!!  Congrats!
WOW!!! SWWWEEET  way to go.  YOU WIN	YOU DA KING TODAY
Very nice Paul it looks like it finally is fishing time.   Art
So where's the new boat! I already saw you with that one....I thought you'd bought another one???

Looks great & congrats! That polished hull looks great; if you want it to keep looking great, have a look at Sharkhide. http://www.sharkhide.com/mpinfo.html Don (Deg) uses it on his 21' North River and it still looks like new.
that is one sexy ride!
Good for you man.  I love that new boat feeling.  Your going to have a blast.
Thanks Guys !! Season opener for Pickerel in about a week.Gotta show uze i'm not just another purdy face
Amazing.....how you gonna sleep......lol...i'd be sleeping in it the first few weeks
Well Paul...the Ottawa always needs company, that looks like it could be great for some Musky Trollin, we can follow Matt around and steal his spots.  Very nice!!!!
Or he can follow me around and keep his boat clean.
congrats Paul. Nice candy!!
Here is a tip from your Uncle Arttie: If you are going to follow Roy around make sure you copy down his boat numbers cause he is hard to see over the gunwales. Humph tillers....who needs em.    Art
Nice ride Paul
looks great
You are too far East!!! and I would like to catch fish! Not just sight see
Speakin about clean.I just realized that i have to get ooey fish slime all over it  You just bought a pressure washer, didnt ya Roy
very nice,....... for a console......
thats a beauty ... i have a 14 ft princecraft with a 9.9 ..... but thats reeeeeeel nice
Very Nice!!!!
